summary: Analyzed reflexive vs irreflexive temporal operators for canonical model construction. Recommended keeping G/H primitive (irreflexive) with indexed MCS family approach that uses different maximal consistent sets at each time point connected by temporal coherence conditions.

artifacts.summary: Research report analyzing reflexive vs irreflexive temporal operators, recommending indexed MCS family approach over same-MCS or reflexive primitive approaches

next_steps: Run /plan 654 to create updated implementation plan incorporating indexed MCS family construction

key_findings: Same-MCS-at-all-times approach fundamentally fails for irreflexive G/H operators
Keeping G/H primitive is feasible using indexed MCS families with coherence conditions
Switching to reflexive G'/H' is not recommended due to axiom changes and unclean derivability
The Temporal 4 axiom (G phi -> GG phi) is crucial for compositionality in indexed approach
Estimated effort for indexed MCS implementation: ~24 hours
